description: From French adverbe, from Latin adverbium, from ad- (“to”) +‎ verbum (“word, verb”), so called because it is used to supplement other words.

entries.meaning: (grammar) A word that modifies a verb, adjective, other adverbs, or various other types of words, phrases, or clauses.
(programming) In the Raku programming language, a named parameter that modifies the behavior of a routine.
(grammar) A word that modifies a verb, adjective, other adverbs, or various other types of words, phrases, or clauses.
examples: (modifying a verb) I often went outside hiking during my stay in Japan.
(modifying an adjective) It was often cold outside.

entries.meaning: (programming) In the Raku programming language, a named parameter that modifies the behavior of a routine.

verbs.description: adverb (third-person singular simple present adverbs, present participle adverbing, simple past and past participle adverbed)

entries.meaning: (rare) To make into or become an adverb.
